attributes.action: Include an option to state disagreement with a petition on the petition website.
attributes.background:
Petitions of opposing viewpoints already exist on this website and some positions may gather support but still be opposed by a greater number of people. 
By including an option to "disagree with this petition" the petitions process can be simplified and made more representative of public opinion.

attributes.action: Introduce a standardised 'no added sugar' label
attributes.background: Being in the situation of needing to make lifestyle changes and cutting down on sugar, it turned out to be a lot more difficult to find food and drinks without added sugar than expected. Most processed food contains added sugar, not just the obvious sweets, cake and fizzy drinks!
attributes.additional_details: The red, amber and green food labelling has made it easier to identify healthier food and drinks but added sugar can still only be identified by going through the list of ingredients. In a time of increasing numbers of diabetes, obesity, cancer and other conditions a healthy lifestyle should be made easy. Natural sugar is still sugar but the way healthier option as it comes combined with nutrients.

attributes.action: Urgent review of Business Rates for Small Businesses
attributes.background: Business Rates in this country are driving existing Businesses into debt and liquidation, preventing them from expanding and new Businesses from forming. The extortionate cost of Business Rates are set far too high and there is very little help available and no incentive for Local Councils to help
attributes.additional_details: To run a Business, premises are often required. Different types of Businesses have different requirements. For example, a Small Office Business may run with low Business Rates and a high turn-over. Where as a Small Manufacturer may require a much larger premises, huge Business Rates, and have a smaller profit margin. We need a fairer and balanced Business Rates system that works for the different types of Businesses, because at the moment it is killing our Small Businesses and preventing growth

attributes.action: lower to a 5% VAT  rather than 20% vet bills and costs to every pet owner
attributes.background: realising i pay more on VAT pet bills than my yearly gas and electric Bill, it's stupid yes pets are an option so I understand the cost but to most elderly a dog/pet is what they get up for every morning it's not fair for them to be paying this amount or anyone for that matter

attributes.action: Make driving lessons and tests government funded and free for candidates.
attributes.background: Driving has become an increasingly vital part of everyday life, and yet learning to drive is ridiculously expensive with lessons costing upwards of £20 per hour and the practical test costing £62 a time, prices that are not feasible for the vast majority of UK citizens.

attributes.action: Make it law that pubs and restaurants have to have diet lemonade available
attributes.background: If you want lemonade in a pub or restaurant then there is a good chance you have to have full sugar content lemonade. For those of us who are watching our waist line or have diabetes this is a real problem.
attributes.additional_details: There is so much pressure now for us all to reduce our sugar intake and pubs and restaurants should aid us in doing this. Also for those of us who are the designated driver and do not like coke/pepsi, this really restricts the drinks available to us.

attributes.action: Increase the capacity of prisons by building 5 new prisons by 2022.
attributes.background: Throughout the UK over the last few years the increase of crime has put pressure onto prisons and the justice system. Therefore because there aren't enough spaces in prisons, criminals may get away with crimes they have committed. If more prisons are built, it will create more space for criminals.

attributes.action: More funding for a cure for patients suffering with IBD
attributes.background: The two main forms of inflammatory bowel disease are Crohn’s disease and ulcerative colitis. Both are chronic diseases that cause inflammation of the digestive system. As well as these intestinal problems, the disease may be associated with abnormalities of the joints, eyes, liver and skin.
attributes.additional_details: Crohn’s disease is the inflammation of the digestive system which leads to diarrhoea, abdominal pain, tiredness and weight loss. Ulcerative colitis is a lifelong disease that is associated with significant morbidity. With Ulcerative Colitis being the most common of the two most patients are diagnosed under the age of 25. Having the start of our lives filled with doctors appointments, hospital apppointments, to be used on clinical trials for drugs that can only surpress and not cure our illness.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to burn state flags of all countries.
attributes.background: As we all know the UK is a very diverse and multicultural place especially London. For this reason, many people from different ethnics are united by flags that represent them. We must make it illegal to burn flags to decrease growing hate of different ethnics towards each other. eg Turks vs Kurds.

attributes.action: Call a referendum on whether or not we have a transitional deal from March 2019.
attributes.background: Ask that the Government now give the British people a referendum on whether or not we have a transitional deal from March 2019. If the vote is no, then there must be no transitional deal, and we must be out of the single market, the customs union and the rulings of EU courts from March 2019.
attributes.additional_details: There are more Remain supporting MPs than Leave supporting MPs. Parliament cannot be trusted. The Government now seems intent on making a transitional deal from March 2019 and giving the EU large sums of UK taxpayers` money from that date. The period from June 2016 to March 2019 should be considered sufficient for everyone to adapt to a full break from the EU in March 2019.

attributes.action: Make PIP awards subject to a letter from a persons medical team only.
attributes.background: PIP awards are currently subject to an assessment with a healthcare representative. These people are unaware of the majority of medical conditions presented to them. I propose that a person applying for PIP, should be awarded this based on a report produced by their medical team looking after them.

attributes.action: Remove VAT from home insulation and damp proofing products.
attributes.background:
Home insulation, damp proofing and draught exclusion are the top three most effective and simple means of reducing energy cost and emissions whilst improving environmental health.
Charging VAT on insulation, damp proofing and draught exclusion is hobbling those who do most to help the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
The laws of physics and the governments own agencies agree with the priorities for energy efficiency and reduction of environmental cost/ damage.
Removal of VAT would be the single, simplest and most effective action whilst avoiding the high administration cost of the more complex and corruptible schemes.

attributes.action: Revoke Independent Schools' Charitable Status
attributes.background: Over the next 5 years the public will Subsidize £522 million in tax breaks to private schools in which 7% of the wealthy few attend. This is thanks to their status as charities. We call on the government to remove charitable status,  and thus taxpayer support,  from fee-paying schools

attributes.action: Revisit the NHS Pay Deal 2018 as the initial communications were misleading
attributes.background: The detail released to NHS staff and Unions from NHS Employers was misleading and staff and unions have voted based on the information initially provided. This has resulted in large numbers of staff not receiving a 6% pay increase over 3 years as communicated.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on the UK remaining/leaving the Customs Union
attributes.background: In 2016 the British people voted to leave the EU . However there’s still no consensus on what form a Brexit can take which has caused much conflict on issues like trade and the Irish border .A simple solution would be to allow the electorate to decide if we leave or remain in the Customs Union.

attributes.action: To legally stagger school holidays in each county in England
attributes.background: The current holiday system for schools forces holiday prices up very high in current school hols as all parents want holidays at similar times. Spreading this demand out by schools having different weeks off would lower prices for families but shouldn’t affect holiday companies profit. Help!!
attributes.additional_details: This is an ongoing issue known by everyone. I think rather than sitting back and letting families struggle for years to take their kids away something should be done. It’s not feasible to ask holiday companies to change prices without demand changing and the only way that can change is the government changing school holidays in England. Help families. Don’t just accept how it is!!

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for all NHS staff
attributes.background: NHS staff are dedicated and commited to providing excellent healthcare for all people, however on the low wages they receive it seems only fair that they can take care of themselves too as a thank you.

attributes.action: Free Meals For All Kids in Primary Schools
attributes.background: Kids in Primary School should have free Schools meals. If the Prisoners have free meals why kids can’t have them too.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe that should be addressed and actioned! 
Please sign my petition and let all kids have a free warm meal at school.

attributes.action: Equal rights for Fathers-to-be to be paid leave for antenatal appointments.
attributes.background: In a society where equal rights matter, I believe Fathers-to-be should be allowed the same right as the Mother-to-be. This is the right of paid time off for antenatal care, of which equally includes antenatal or parenting classes if they’ve been recommended by a doctor or midwife.
attributes.additional_details:
Statutory Paternity Pay and Leave: employer guide:-
https://www.gov.uk/employers-paternity-pay-leave

Pregnant employees' rights:-
https://www.gov.uk/working-when-pregnant-your-rights

Equality Act 2010:-
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/equality-act-2010-guidance

attributes.action: Mandatory Mental Health First Aid Training for Children's/Youth Workers
attributes.background: Compulsory Mental Health First Aid Training for Children's/Youth workers will ensure that leaders know what to do if a young person is experiencing a mental health crisis. By recognising the signs early and knowing what to do in each circumstance, leaders can create greater safety for young people.
attributes.additional_details: If a young person grazes their knee, or breaks their ankle while on a residential, noticing the symptoms and treating the problem can be simple for a first aider. If a mental health crisis occurs, the issue may be troublesome to overcome if a leader is not trained in mental health first aid. 1 in 10 young people experience a mental health issue at a given time (https://mhfaengland.org/individuals/youth/) yet the subject is still stigmatised and brushed under the carpet. https://mhfaengland.org/

attributes.action: No one can become an MP without having worked 15 years in the workplace.
attributes.background: 'Career' politicians do not have experience of our lives in the UK.  The 'workplace' is defined as any job that is not associated with politics.  EG salaried lobbyists and union representatives would not be able to become MPs unless they had also worked in other professions for 15 years.
attributes.additional_details: Too many current politicians take PPE at university, join lobby or other political organisations, then seek a parliamentary seat.  Ambition, rather than vocation, is their motivation; this is not in the national interest.  Parliament lacks expertise in industrial, engineering, and practical areas.  Academics are needed too, but most decisions require life experiences that the majority of MPs do not have.  We need you to work for us, not just further your ambitions, and play power games.

attributes.action: Legislate to ensure all future England football matches are 'free to air'
attributes.background:
The excitement, drama, joy & pain of being an England supporter has been made so evident to a new generation. 

We should encourage those fans to hold their interest in the wonderful game and allow TV licence paid access for all of them and us diehards too. 

No satellite/cable//other fee needed
attributes.additional_details:
Euro 2020 Final is at Wembley on 12th July 2020.

Let us be there all the way.

It's coming home!

This wiki about OfCom, the Broadcasting Act 1996 & subsequent Regulations shows only that only the finals for Euro 2020 are covered and that all other qualifying matches/friendlies will be pay per view or subscription. 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ofcom_Code_on_Sports_and_Other_Listed_and_Designated_Events

attributes.action: Ban plastic carrier bags completely, this is to include ALL retailers.
attributes.background:
As we all know plastic is doing really bad things for our environment but yet the vast majority of us still use plastic bags daily when we buy groceries, cloths etc.

This should not be an option, there are alternatives, people just need to be prepared and carry an eco friendly bag, backpack etc.

attributes.action: Replace the compulsory subject of RE for basic level psychology and counselling.
attributes.background: We are in the middle of a mental health revolution. The world of psychology is making advances and stigmas are being broken down in society. Mental health effects everybody either directly or indirectly and it is our duty to make sure children are given the tools needed to deal with these issues.
attributes.additional_details: In our modern day of technology wasting precious educational time and taxpayers money to teach religion is outdated. Any teenager has access to the internet where they can learn about any religion to their hearts content. Instead with this time we can introduce teens to basic level psychology. To get children asking questions, growing their knowledge on issues and learning how to deal them. Many time it takes humans a while to learn about themselves so the more headstart we can give the better.

attributes.action: Make medical insurance compulsory for foreign nationals visiting the UK.
attributes.background: When visiting a foreign country, UK citizens are required to take out travel / medical insurance. This should be made compulsory for foreign nationals. This could save millions of pounds for the NHS.

attributes.action: Portable barbecues, not disposed of safely, start wildfires. Restrict their sale
attributes.background: Many wildfires start with a hot disposable barbecue left to smoulder. They should be sold responsibly with clear, robust advice about the risks. And proper advice about the very real risk of wild fires.
attributes.additional_details:
I’ve just seen a serious moorland fire which lasted for several
Days. It was started by a disposable barbecue left in a car park. Supposedly extinguished but resurrected by breezes. Causing risk to local
Property and residents, firefighters, farm animals and wild life

attributes.action: Government to take back FULL control of the Rail Network, end Privatisation!
attributes.background:
In recent years, the uk Rail Network has seen reckless actions in regards to weak bids that have fallen through, clauses that have cost millions of pounds and numerous bail outs & takeovers that where unnecessary, or preventable! 

We feel it’s time the the UK regains control of its train network
attributes.additional_details:
The state of the Bidding process is flawed, calling for multiple amendments and cost franchisees and the taxpayer millions of pounds.

It seems to be that operators are more interested in making money than seeing the needs of its key objectives that involve passengers and rail infrastructure!

The state of the past and present of the East Coast Mainline, Great Western Mainline, and many other areas of UK Franchises having final warnings or ‘Bail outs’.

It’s time the UK Rail became Public again!

attributes.action: Give disabled young people more support to get on the housing ladder
attributes.background:
The young persons network in Herefordshire which supports young people to have a voice would like government to consider supporting young people to get onto the housing ladder.

This could be by making more homes accessible throughout the uk and offering funding packages specifically targeted YP
attributes.additional_details:
Our lead was been trying to live independently in a rented/brought house, but has struggled to find suitable housing in his local area.

The only option that he has found so far is buying a house and then having it adapted to suit his needs this could cost thousands.

Unfortunately he is not the only disabled young person in this position thousands of young disabled people across the uk want to live independently in there own home.

I want the govt to make funding ready for accessible homes

attributes.action: Parliament to set aside time to debate the rules whereby MPs put forward bills
attributes.background: Following the wrecking of two bills which had received extensive scrutiny by departments, and were supported by ministers, by a single MP calling "object" on a Friday afternoon, time should be set aside by Parliament to consider and amend the rules whereby MPs can introduce bills to the House.
attributes.additional_details: A single MP is currently able to wreck private members' bills by talking them out, or objecting.

attributes.action: The government should give every citizen,young and old,a fresh fruit/veg voucher
attributes.background: The government should give every citizen, young and old, a fresh fruit/veg voucher EACH WEEK to the sum of £25 and this amount should be raised by taxing unhealthy food.
attributes.additional_details: The government should be doing more to encourage people to eat more fresh fruit/veg. This can be easily achieved if all the population, young and old, are given an amount each week so spend solely on this produce. The money required could be raised by the government by raising tax on unhealthy food.

attributes.action: Make cyclists require a cycling licence that they must carry at all times.
attributes.background: I have nearly been hit three times by cyclists going at high speed around corners. Cyclists never use bells anymore so silently sneak up on you and shoot past (on the pavement).
attributes.additional_details: Many people have called for regulation of cycling. This has been impractical as bikes do not need reg numbers (like cars) but this proposal is new. I propose that cyclists themselves should have to purchase a licence from the DVLA which can be revoked if guilty of dangerous cycling.

attributes.action: Don't Raise Income Tax to pay for NHS - Find Alternative Source of Funds
attributes.background: Research has suggested that income tax may have to rise, by as much as £2,000 per household, to meet the future needs of the NHS. This would be unacceptable when the public is struggling to even scrape by.

attributes.action: More help available for people who are suffering with mental health issues
attributes.background:
For many of us with mental health we have been failed by the services on offer within the NHS, We are often the ones left to one side. 

Offer more help to people who are admitted to A&E 

make more beds available in hospitals for people with mental health instead of sending us home to suffer.
attributes.additional_details:
We need early intervention available instead of being left until it’s simply to late. 

We need more beds available as many of us who attend A&E are often told that no beds are available or are not even offered one. 

Data compiled for the BBC by NHS Digital showed that between 2011-12 and 2015-16 the number of patients attending A&E units with psychiatric problems rose by nearly 50% to 165,000.

For the under 18s alone the numbers almost doubled to nearly 22,000.

attributes.action: Impose a maximum booking fee on online cinema ticket purchases.
attributes.background: Some cinemas can charge upwards of £1.75 on top of the price of a ticket just to book it online instead of at the cinema which is blatantly extortionate. A reasonable cap either as a fixed amount or as a percentage of the ticket price should be imposed.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to get a licence to own an animal.
attributes.background: This is a petition to make anybody who wants to own any animal have a licence. There is so much animal abuse that goes on and this is a step in the right direction to start protecting innocent creatures. With a view to the licence fee being used to police animal cruelty at street level.
attributes.additional_details: The licence would ideally be linked with an animal abusers register that is also being petitioned for. Please remember that if nobody speaks up, nothing will change, and animals do not have a voice. We are their voice and we have to be heard. Thankyou.

attributes.action: Revamp the House of Lords to only 400 members all of whom are Life Peers.
attributes.background: The House of Lords has become far too large for its purpose.
attributes.additional_details: Only the Chinese government has a bigger second chamber than the UK - which is absurd. The House of Lords no longer represents its national needs.

attributes.action: Give equal survivor pension benefits to widows and widowers of female teachers.
attributes.background: Men and women have always paid equal contributions into the teachers' pension scheme. However, widowers of women teachers continue to receive lower amounts than widows of men teachers. The DfE recently announced that spouses / civil partners of same-sex couples will receive equal benefits to widows.
attributes.additional_details:
The bereaved spouses of teachers receive different levels of pension benefits, depending on gender and sexual orientation. Men married to women are disadvantaged compared to those in all other legal relationships. Survivors receive 50% of their partner's pension accrued since 1972. However, only contributions since 1988 count towards survivor benefits for the husbands of female teachers. 
See: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/occupational-pension-schemes-review-of-survivor-benefits

attributes.action: Government should continue annual  breast examinations with a breast surgeon
attributes.background: Current Breast cancer follow-up includes yearly mammogram with breast examination with a breast surgeon and request additional tests for 5 years. NHS has now started implementing new open access (stratified) follow up pathway with no  annual breast examinations with a breast surgeon
attributes.additional_details: Patients will only have a mammogram and no breast examination by surgeon.Ladies has to rely on their own examination skills, which is very dangerous.This will risk patients lives. Mammograms are not sensitive and needs to be complemented by breast examination and other investigations +_ tissue sampling.Govt should continue annual mandatory breast examinations  by breast surgeon and stop implementing this dangerous stratified followup pathway.

attributes.action: Scrap driving theory test
attributes.background: The theory test is a waste of time, effort and most importantly money. I think it should be removed for good.

attributes.action: Refuse to take part in war in Syria and find a diplomatic path to peace
attributes.background: Bombing Syria will not help the situation. It will kill more civilians and ignite a conflict that could spiral out of control, causing massive devastation. We call on the government to refuse to engage in the conflict. Focus on political solutions and aiding diplomacy between the US and Russia
attributes.additional_details: A conflict in Syria between U.S. and Russian forces is not only something that we cannot afford to take part in, it's something we should do everything in our power to prevent. The potential consequences of such a conflict - a huge civilian death toll and the risk of igniting nuclear war - are things that need to be avoided at all costs. We urge the government not to take part in any military action in Syria but instead, with urgency, focus all available resources on finding political solutions and aiding diplomatic relations between the U.S. and Russian governments.

attributes.action: Subsidy on "free from" products for people with food allergies
attributes.background: After having a child who is food intolerant to several things including dairy, wheat and fish & meeting several people in similar positions who all struggle to get anything on prescription, I want to petition for the Government to provide a subsidy for these expensive but necessary items.

attributes.action: Create regulatory body to set the standards and ethics of AI development.
attributes.background: Working under the acronym OF-AIR - Office of AI Regulation, this organisation would utilise respected minds across areas such as Ethical Philosophy, Law and Technology to regulate the means and use of AI across technological sectors to prevent industrial monopoly or unethical development.
attributes.additional_details: From self driving cars or platooning vehicles, to corrupt algorithms manipulating politics and ultimately the ability to create robots that can 'think for themselves', what was once the realms of Science Fiction is now upon us as a reality and should be controlled to prevent corruption across both industry and individuals and to mitigate political and unlawful gain.

attributes.action: Change the A1 license - Motorcycle
attributes.background: My suggested change is if you are 18+ Years old and obtain an A1 license you can ride a motorcycle up to a 300cc with no power greater than 23 kw (30 bhp) Restrictions can be placed on the bike. This will give people an incentive to obtain this license. Making more people do motorcycle training.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently you can obtain an A1 license at 17+ Years old Which allows you to ride a motorcycle up to a 125cc with no more power of 11kw (15 bhp) you no longer display L plates, you can carry a pillion and have access to the motorway. 

Cbt allows you to ride a motorcycle up to a 125cc with no more power of 11kw (15 bhp) as long as you display L plates front and back, don’t Carry pillions and don’t go onto the motorway.

17 year olds have no restriction on what car they can drive after passing.

attributes.action: Start supplementing milk with Vitamin D.
attributes.background: Many countries supplement their milk supply with vitamin d and the UK which rarely gets sunshine does not.
attributes.additional_details: There has been evidence showing that many in the UK suffer from vitamin d deficiencies.

attributes.action: Stop roll out of "Academies" to SEN schools.
attributes.background: Stop rolling out academy schools to SEN Schools. How can a private company do better? It's all about money. How can a shared head teacher have lead in the school? The situation is wrong. The government want to pass schools on, reduce budgets and then blame someone else for the schools doing bad.

attributes.action: Mandatory weekly hour classes in current politics in secondary schools.
attributes.background: Give secondary school children a chance to learn about the different parties in the UK and their policies (etc) from an unbiased perspective. Learn about current affairs both locally and abroad, voting etc. Give everyone the right to unbiased knowledge to make well informed decisions as adults.
attributes.additional_details: I propose hour classes once a week in order to keep children engaged and updated. Teach the requirements for voting, the process of voting, current party policies for each party, practice voting etc. Engage in current debates and learn of foreign affairs that affect both the UK and the world. Allow them the advantage of awareness when coming to the voting age for both fair and thoroughly considered decisions. Studying Holocaust Literature in my degree has inspired me to propose this.

attributes.action: Bring back nit nurse to UK schools send them home till treated and clear 2018
attributes.background:
Sick of nits £££ on products such as treatments and repellents.
Hours spent combing through hair.
Laundry through constant washing.
Kids crying you pulling and tugging to the point you want to shave their head.
attributes.additional_details:
Abroad they still have nit nurses that come to check children’s heads in school regularly, once head lice are found the child is sent home and not allowed to return till rechecked and cleared.
I lived abroad and this works 100%.
Eliminates before it can even start to spread.
Desperate mum of a girl with beautiful long hair that seriously can’t take this anymore.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of endometriosis, for all women 18 to 60 +
attributes.background: Raise awareness of endometriosis, for all women 18 to 60 +,men if they know women who are effected. for delivery within professional and public services such as doctors, women's health clinics, to raise awareness of issues faced, treatment by doctors and early detection.
attributes.additional_details: is is important to gain a better understanding of the long term costs and implications to health of those who are effected, awareness of the amount of women affected, hereditary implications and risks associated such as forced hysterectomies, major surgeries and the long term implications to finances and employment of those concerned due to pain and discomfort of symptoms.

attributes.action: Require Schools in England to teach & sing the National Anthem once a week
attributes.background: Only 35% of the UK are proud to be British says a recent poll, this is a giant drop from 10 years ago! Why? The UK with England at it's heart invented the most popular sports. Have legends in Music, Arts, Science, Finance.. Team GB came 2nd at the Olympics!! So let's help regrow the National pride!!
attributes.additional_details: The USA, France and many countries sing their Anthem weekly in schools. Why do we not? We have so much to be proud of. From Yorkshire Puddings to Julie Dench, Mo Farah to Harry Potter. Whether it's Music, Arts, Sports, Commerce or any other possible area England are up there and dominating. Patriotism is falling rapidly, we need to help regrow the passion and allow our children to be taught the Anthem in Schools and to be proud like they should be of the great Country which they are living in.

attributes.action: Make Recycling Compulsory
attributes.background: The united kingdom is falling behind on the amount of recycling compared to other European countries. We could fix this by making recycling compulsory, a tax reduction (similar to charity donations) and education for younger generations that will encourage new generations to recycle more often.
attributes.additional_details: The United Kingdom is falling behind on recycling rates compared to other developed nations such as France and Germany causing 60% of waste going to landfill. This needs to change. I propose that we can end this through making recycling compulsory, through methods such as: an increase tax for if landfill waste increases, a tax reduction for companies that increase the percentage recycled, similar to charity donations and encouraging new generations to recycle through education within schools.
